issue.title: [match] fix error with universal provisioning filter ("'UNIVERSAL' is not a valid filter value")

repository.name: fastlane

Closes #29497

### Description

<!-- Describe your changes in detail, as well as how you tested them. -->

Removes `UNIVERSAL` device filter

body: Can confirm the same issue, probably a change in apple backend?
Is there any workaround? and seems the issue is happening only on developer account for organisation.

> Is there any workaround? and seems the issue is happening only on developer account for organisation.

workaround is in the PR I have attached above
I'm having the same issue here

I was having trouble with a Fastlane error on the CI server. However, I was able to resolve it by specifying `readonly: true` (just as the error message suggested).
I usually update the provisioning profile on my local machine, and the CI server only needs to fetch it.
(That said, this issue had already occurred right after I updated the provisioning profile on my local machine, so it's still a mystery why it worked...)
